oai_dc:dc.dc:title: General order No. 5 from Executive Headquarters, Memphis, Tennessee

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Armed Forces -- Reserves; Harris, Isham G. (Isham Green), 1818-1897; Military Orders
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: General order No. 5 issued by Governor and Commander-in-Chief Isham G. Harris and Adjutant General W. C. Whitthorne to organize the state's Reserve Military Corps as required by an act of the General Assembly passed March 18, 1862.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee -- Adjutant-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Historical Society Civil War Collection, 1860-1982
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: General orders are published directives issued by a commander, binding upon all personnel under his command, and affecting policies or procedures unique to a unit's situation not addressed by service regulations. General orders have the force of law within a unit. This order was issued by Isham G. Harris to mobilize the Reserve Corps for the Confederate forces after he refused to provide support for the Federal government.
